title: Adam Rickitt joins Hollyoaks 13 years after leaving Coronation Street
text:

Former Coronation Street favourite Adam Rickitt has joined the cast of Hollyoaks. 
The 38-year-old actor will play Nancy Osborne’s ex-boyfriend Kyle. 
He’s due to appear on screen for the first time in April. 
Kyle will bump into Nancy at a support meeting for people living with MS. Adam Rickett joins Hollyoaks (Photo: Channel 4) 
As they reminisce about their past romance, old feelings for each other will come back. 
Show bosses also hinted that Kyle will have other connections in Hollyoaks that will make sure his arrival brings drama to the village. 
But Adam is no stranger to soaps – he previously starred in Coronation Street as Nick Tilsley. He will appear on our screens in April (Photo: Channel 4) 
Nick played the blonde curtain-haired teen from 1997 to 1999 and again from 2002 to 2004. 
He then moved to New Zealand to play the role of Kieran Mitchell in medical soap opera Shortland Street. 
He also had a brief singing career – getting to number five with his single I Breathe Again in 1999. Adam Rickitt in his Coronation Street days (Photo: Granada Television) Adam played Nick Tilsley until 2004 (Photo: ITV / TPC) 
"I am really happy to be joining Hollyoaks,” Adam said. 
“I've had a lot of friends work on the show throughout the years and they've all told me what an amazing place it is to work so it's really good to be a part of such a welcoming crowd. 
"The key interest for me was in the storylines lined up for Kyle. I think they are amazing, taking the character on a real journey and something I am really enjoying playing a part in. Fingers crossed the audience like the surprises as they keep coming…" Like us on Facebook
